title: Recording emotions instead of thoughts
description: Feelings cannot be refuted in an adaptive response and should be recorded in a separate step.
right: I think I won’t be able to cope

title: Vague formulations
description: An automatic thought may be recorded too generally.
right: I think my colleagues consider me incompetent

title: Recording facts instead of interpretations
description: It is important to note your attitude toward the event. The fact of the event was recorded in the previous step.
right: Now my boss will think I’m irresponsible

title: Too complex and confusing formulation
description: Thoughts should be recorded simply and clearly; otherwise, it will be difficult to provide an adaptive response.
wrong: I tend to believe that my opinion doesn’t matter
right: My opinion doesn’t matter to anyone

title: Skipping the automatic thought
description: Some people immediately record alternative thoughts or responses to automatic thoughts.
right: I’m not sure I can handle it

title: Ignoring key thoughts
description: Sometimes people only record thoughts that seem more acceptable, ignoring key or painful automatic thoughts.
wrong: I’m a bit worried about the future
